track.name: Battery
comments:
Now where I live there's a homeless man.
He sits upon a crate
Yeah, He makes a rusty trumpet sound like the music that angels make.
Now if you ever come and visit me, I suggest you watch the show
Tell him Aesop Rock sent ya just to hear his horn blow like this
Kinda almost sortof makes me wish I could still play trumpet, but then I remember how much I actually hated it and just go back to enjoying the song :)
My favorite hip hop track ever.
My favorite Aesop track ever.

this is absolutely amazing. i LOVE the cello and bass. so good. sooo, sooo, good.
<3
~"See, your name is ambiguity.   My name is something hands can't hold but hearts part ocean scapes just to watch the starlet unfold"~
buy that man a brand new horn
amaaaaazing
yes this album is front-to-back incredible. Aesop is a lyrical genius.
Around this point is when you realise the album is brilliant.
as a witness to beauty born like thissssssssss...
Aesop one of the greatest of all time!!! there I said it Jay-Z use to have those type of skills but he chose to go commercial. Aesop keep it going for the tru hip hop feens!!!
probably in top 2 aesop songs for me anyway
this guy rocks - ha, that was unintentional...
Bedlam!
edel!
he is the fuckingS H I T !
ready for life in this city
Juxtapose
There's smoke in my iris but I painted a sunny day on the insides of my eyelids..
